intro: Ecbolium angustatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Ecbolium angustatum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
